messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] help needed
messages.msgSnippet: ... She might not WANT to read that much, even after she learns. Have you been trying to teach her to read?  Is there pressure? How did your other kids learn
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 5, 2006, at 1:57 PM, Angela wrote:

> i would let her read till her eyeballs
> fell out


She might not WANT to read that much, even after she learns.

Have you been trying to teach her to read? Is there pressure? How
did your other kids learn to read?

http://sandradodd.com/reading

Lots of stories and ideas there.

Sandra

messages.subject: help needed
messages.msgSnippet: hello everyone. my name is Angela. i homeschool/unschool my 4 children. everyone is learning fine except my daughter. she is 12 and not reading yet. she just
messages.messageBody:
hello everyone. my name is Angela. i homeschool/unschool my 4
children. everyone is learning fine except my daughter. she is 12 and
not reading yet. she just has no desire to learn it. she thinks she
doesnt need it. i am starting tolose patience honestly as this is VERy
important to me. if she could read...well i would probably never ask
her to do another thing again. iwould let her read till her eyeballs
fell out:-D
my question is what do i do? i am afraid if i seek help from and
outside source, then i will be turned in for *neglecting* her
education and she will be taken away from me as well as my other
children.
any ideas on what i should do?
Angela
